intro: Leptostachya comata var. humifusa, commonly known as the hairy leek orchid, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the alpine regions of southern Australia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage and pale green to white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss and climate change, it is considered vulnerable, highlighting the need for its protection.
